articles.author: Clive
articles.description: Dane Nikoline Splittorff finished strongly with a 60-point lead in the women’s World Cup, and Finnish rider André Haga ended 52 points ahead in the men’s, thanks largely to a good first half of the season. This is Splittorff’s third overall victory in successive years; Haga was fifth last year and seventh in 2022. Through […]
articles.title: CX80 MTBO World Cup: Splittorff and Haga take top places; Team World Cup to Finland

articles.author: Clive
articles.description: Denmark dominated the women’s race throughout, winning by almost 5 minutes, whilst Czechia’s men retained their title from 2023 with victory by just 16 seconds in dull and damp conditions near Shumen, Bulgaria today. Cæcilie Christoffersen started strongly for Denmark in the women’s race and was 1.28 in the lead at the first changeover. At […]
articles.title: CX80 WMTBOC: Denmark and Czechia take Relay titles

articles.author: Clive
articles.description: Nikoline Splittorff, Denmark and Vojtech Ludvik, Czechia successfully defended their Long Distance titles in a demanding race in hilly Bulgarian terrain today. Ludvik finished with a 1.54 lead and Splittorff won by 20 seconds. The very experienced Czech rider Martina Tichovska was best in the early stages, and passed the 8.6 km point in the […]
articles.title: CX80 WMTBOC Long race: defending champions both win; 3 medals to Denmark

articles.author: Erling Thisted
articles.description: The gold medals went to Gabriele Andrasiuniene (LTU) and defending champion Krystof Bogar (CZE) on the third day of CX80 World MTBO Championships in Bulgaria. The sun was back on Thursday morning as the athletes rode off on the Middle distance at the southern end of the forest terrain that was also used for yesterday’s […]
articles.title: CX80 WMTBOC: Middle wins for Andrasiuniene and Bogar

articles.author: Erling Thisted
articles.description: The International Orienteering Federation relies on voluntary work by passionate orienteers all around the world. And right now IOF is looking to strengthen its commissions with new members and volunteers for the period 2024-2026. If you would like to influence the development of orienteering in the coming years and gain experience of working in an […]
articles.title: Be part of shaping the future of orienteering

articles.author: Erling Thisted
articles.description: Jan Hasek (CZE) won his second gold medal in two days when the CX80 WMTBOC-athletes raced the mass start on Wednesday. Among the women, the leader in the World Cup, Nikoline Splittorff (DEN), was the fastest and became world champion. Yesterday’s nice weather was replaced by rain when the athletes were sent off into the […]
articles.title: CX80 WMTBOC: Hasek wins second gold as Splittorff take women’s Mass start title

articles.author: Erling Thisted
articles.description: Ruska Saarela (FIN) and Jan Hasek (CZE) won the first gold medals at the 2024 CX80 World MTBO Championships, which began in Bulgaria on Tuesday. The championships kicked off with the sprint: 9,3/10,8 kilometers for women and men respectively in the old city of Pliska, featuring a flat terrain with a dense network of small […]
articles.title: CX80 WMTBOC: Sprint golds for Saarela and Hasek

articles.author: Clive
articles.description: Five races between 10th and 15th September will decide the 2024 World Champions and the World Cup winners for 2024; 110 riders from 22 nations will be competing for the medals. They will be joined by a further 73 riders from 18 nations for the Junior championships. The current individual world champions will all be […]
articles.title: CX80 World MTBO Championships: riders from 22 nations head for Bulgaria

articles.author: Erling Thisted
articles.description: Last week, from August 28th to September 1st, the South East European Orienteering Championships, the South East European Masters Orienteering Championships and the 3rd Pergamon O-Week took place in Bergama, Türkiye, with participation of 759 athletes from 22 countries. Besides contributing to the growth of orienteering at both regional and international level, the championships were […]
articles.title: Well attended SEEOC held in Türkiye

articles.description:
Everyone intending to enter Nationals 2025 needs to be aware of the embargoes in place for the event. The team felt it was refreshing to race against athletes who were also students, as opposed to the full-time professionals seen in the World Cup and WOC. Unfortunately, some team members faced illness and […]

Driving time is approximately 4.5 hours from either end, and domestic flights to New Plymouth airport take about one hour. After you’ve warmed up on Taranaki’s middle and long distance, it’s another 3 hours’ […]

articles.author: Christo Peters
articles.description:
The protégé effect is a learning phenomenon where teaching and preparing to teach information to others helps a person learn that information. Jakob has fast tracked his knowledge of orienteering super-fast by growing his knowledge as he introduces the sport to others in the community.  Jakob Abernethy began orienteering three years ago in Year 8, inspired by […]
Jakob’s journey aligns with acceleration of the sport first appeared on Orienteering New Zealand.
articles.title: Jakob’s journey aligns with acceleration of the sport

articles.description:
On August 2nd, the Red Kiwi Orienteering Club hosted the second Manawatū Schools’ Relay Championships. This year, we saw participation from 246 students across 25 schools, marking an increase of 60 students and 6 new schools from last year. Leading up to the event, club members visited interested schools to teach orienteering skills through classroom […]
